author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: He was an old man who fished alone in a skiff in the Gulf Stream and he had gone eighty-four days now without taking a fish.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: The fish is my friend too... I have to kill him. I can’t think about that.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: He was an old man, and the ocean was his enemy. But he knew it.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: The old man was dreaming about the lions.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: You did not kill the fish only to kill him. You killed him to keep him.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: He was a fisherman, and he had no other life but this.

author: Ernest Hemingway
book: The Old Man and the Sea
quote: The sea is my friend, and I am his.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: I am not brave any longer, darling. I am all broken.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: In the late summer of that year, we lived in a house in a village that was not far from the city.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: There is no friend as loyal as a book.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The world is a fine place and worth the fighting for.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: You are not a bad person. You are only a person.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: When people talk, listen completely.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The world is a fine place and worth fighting for and I hate very much to leave it.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Do not think that the world will be saved by people who think they know what they are doing.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: He had never heard the words so clearly as he heard them in his head.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The earth is a great and mighty mother, but the battlefield is its worst child.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Never think that war, no matter how necessary, nor how justified, is not a crime.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: You cannot die if you don’t want to.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: You can't get away from yourself by moving from one place to another.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: I can't stand it to think my life is going so fast and I'm not really living it.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: You are all a lost generation.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: I have a very strong feeling that I should never marry.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward, but it is the journey that matters in the end.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The only thing that is important is that I know what I am and what I believe.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: I wish I had more time to spend with you.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: I am not really interested in politics.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: We are all in this together.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: We are all in a kind of poverty, but some are more aware of it than others.
